content.description:
One of the best in SB. Also one of the most devious, subtle, and just plain ridiculously hard problems you may ever encounter. Begin with hands matched on improbable sloper, hook something (anything...) with your right heel, and conjure your way to the top.

No spoilers...sorry.
content.location: Far left arete of the Cracked Boulder.

content.description: If you thought the moves on She Made Me Do It were great, try doing them in reverse! While possibly gimmicky (I mean, where else do you get to do a dyno with your feet), this problem touts some cruxes that are every bit as vicious as She Made Me Do It, if not more so. In case you're wondering, no, you don't reverse the moves from the top of Mutants Amok. Simply start from the beginning jug of Mutants Amok, then move left, eventually finishing on Le Fissure King.
content.location: Begins on the starting hold of Mutants Amok, on the far right of The Cracked Boulder.

content.description:
Traverse the entire Cracked Boulder from left to right. Undergo an odyssey of hard, awkward, and beta-intensive moves, then finish on Mutants Amok. Begin with left hand on round sloper and right hand on the large edge at the beginning of Le Fissure King.

This is perhaps the most classic traverse in Santa Barbara. Don't leave Skofield without giving it a go.
content.location: Cracked boulder. You can't miss the baffling line of edges, slopers, and crimps.

content.description: Sit start on a good hold a fair amount right of Le Fissure King. Big moves on good edges from there.
content.protection: Pad(s). Kind of a funny landing.
content.location: Right side (looking from the creek) of the Cracked boulder.

content.description:
Sit-start under the overhang and climb out the crack to the top.  One must use a painful finger-lock en route--best to tape up.

Standing start is V0, perhaps harder for shorter climbers.
content.protection: Bad landing; although, the top-out is straightforward.  Crashpad and talented spotter still advisable.
content.location: Overhanging north-face of the Cracked Boulder, overlooking the stream bed.  Scramble down to the stream between the Cracked Boulder and the Slab Boulder.
